page.title: 09Bakewell Puddings
page.content: The famous{Bakewell Pudding, }more often incorrectly called the Bakewell Tart was discovered by accident over one hundred years ago. A flustered cook in the {Rutland Arms Hotel }in Bakewell was making a strawberry tart, but accidentally poured her egg mixture over the strawberry jam instead of mixing it into the pastry. The disastrous strawberry jam tart turned into a delicious new dish. The guests complimented the owner of the hotel on the splendid pudding, and the cook had to confess her mistake to her employer. The {Old Original Bakewell Pudding {Shop,}which stands in Rutland Square, retains the original recipe, which, so it claims, still remains a secret today.
